_comment: Direct outreach templates and strategy for ClawWork client acquisition

strategy.goal: Acquire 3-5 recurring direct clients within 90 days
strategy.acquisition_path: Platform (Upwork/Fiverr) → Complete 1-2 projects → Migrate to direct after delivering excellent work
strategy.off_platform_timing: After 2+ projects, suggest: 'For ongoing work, I can offer you a better rate directly since there's no platform fee.'

pain_points: No time to write listing copy
Need regular market reports for clients
target_profiles.value_prop: I handle your content so you can focus on selling: listings, market reports, email sequences, and CMA support.
target_profiles.identify_via: LinkedIn (search: Real Estate Team Lead, [city]), Instagram (agents with active posting), Upwork history

pain_points: Accountant charges too much for basic reconciliation
Need clean P&L for loan application
target_profiles.value_prop: Monthly bookkeeping and clean P&L reporting for a flat monthly rate. No surprises, no hourly billing.
target_profiles.identify_via: LinkedIn (solo founders, LLC owners in professional services), local business Facebook groups

target_profiles.value_prop: I document your API and create onboarding content that reduces support tickets and accelerates developer adoption.
target_profiles.identify_via: ProductHunt (recent launches), GitHub (repos with no README or sparse docs), LinkedIn (CTO/founder, <20 employees)

pain_points: Domain expertise lacking for tech topics
target_profiles.value_prop: Domain-expert content writer for smart home, real estate, and B2B tech. Articles that reflect genuine expertise, not generic writing.
target_profiles.identify_via: LinkedIn (Content Marketing Manager, VP Marketing at tech companies), AngelList

real_estate_cold.subject: Real estate content support — listings, market reports, email
real_estate_cold.body:
Hi {first_name},

I work with RE teams providing listing descriptions, market reports, and email content.

I've worked extensively in smart home and property tech, so I know the industry and its language. I deliver fast (typically same-day on listings), and I'm happy to do a sample listing or report for free so you can evaluate quality before committing.

Is this something you'd find useful?

{signature}
real_estate_cold.personalization_notes: Reference a recent listing or post of theirs if possible. Mention city/market by name.

bookkeeping_cold.subject: Monthly bookkeeping support — flat rate, no surprises
bookkeeping_cold.body:
Hi {first_name},

I provide monthly bookkeeping services for small businesses — bank reconciliation, expense categorization, and P&L reporting for a flat monthly rate.

Most of my clients pay $150-325/month depending on transaction volume. No hourly billing, no surprise invoices.

I'm happy to do a free one-month trial so you can see the quality of work before committing to anything.

Would that be useful for {business_name}?

{signature}
bookkeeping_cold.personalization_notes: Reference their industry or business type. Mention their city if relevant.

saas_docs_cold.subject: API documentation for {product_name}
saas_docs_cold.body:
Hi {first_name},

I was looking at {product_name} and noticed the API documentation is still in progress. Undocumented APIs are one of the top reasons developers don't complete integrations — I've seen it kill promising products.

I specialize in technical documentation for developer tools and APIs. I can document your full endpoint library, write the integration guide, and create onboarding content that reduces support tickets.

Happy to show you a sample from a similar project. Would that be useful?

{signature}
saas_docs_cold.personalization_notes: Always reference the specific product name and what you found when you looked at their docs (or lack thereof). Be specific.

platform_to_direct_conversion.subject: Ongoing work — better rate directly
platform_to_direct_conversion.body:
Hi {client_name},

It's been great working on {recent_project} with you.

For any ongoing or future projects, I can offer you a better rate directly (outside Upwork/Fiverr) since there's no platform fee involved. This typically saves you 15-20% on the same quality of work.

If you have regular {content_type} needs, a monthly arrangement might make sense. I'd also be happy to continue on a project-by-project basis — whatever works best for you.

Just let me know if you'd like to explore that.

{signature}
platform_to_direct_conversion.personalization_notes: Only send after 2+ successful projects. Reference the specific work you did together.

referral_request.subject: Quick favor — referral
referral_request.body:
Hi {client_name},

Thank you again for the opportunity to work on {recent_project}. I hope it's been useful.

I'm expanding my client base and would love a referral if you know anyone who could use {service_type} support. I'll make sure they receive the same quality and responsiveness you experienced.

Happy to return the favor however I can.

{signature}
referral_request.personalization_notes: Send after a particularly strong review or after a client expresses satisfaction.

follow_up_schedule.day_4: Follow-up 1: Short, adds value (relevant stat or insight)
follow_up_schedule.day_10_message: Hi {first_name} — last follow-up, I promise. If you ever need {service_type} support in the future, I'd be glad to help. Feel free to reach out anytime. No need to respond if this isn't relevant right now.

invoicing.terms: Net 7 for project work; Net 1 (due on delivery) for first-time clients
invoicing.late_payment_policy: Polite reminder at Day 8; pause work at Day 15 if no response
